conversation.text: Hello, would you like to cook Indian food today?
evidence: Get hard-to-find ingredients at an Indian grocery store.

conversation.text: Hi! Yes please. I would like to make Indian Falooda
Soak basil seeds for 30 minutes, then drain
evidence: cover the basil seeds with an inch of water

conversation.text: What kind of strainer can I use?
Great question! For this, you'll use a fine mesh strainer.
Thank you. What shall I do next?
Next, bring milk and sugar to a gentle boil, then simmer.
How long should I let it simmer for?
Ideally you should let simmer for about 5-7 minutes
Thank you. What is the next step please?
Before we move on, may I ask what the consistency of the milk is looking like?
Sure. The milk is looking quite thick in consistency.
Perfect! Just the right consistency we are aiming for. Be sure to pour it into a seperate container and put into the fridge. Once this is done we can make the falooda sev.
evidence: Pour the thickened milk into separate container and let it chill in the fridge.

conversation.text: Lovely! It smells delicious. How do I make the falooda sev?
Do you have dried, brought falooda sev or will you be making it fresh yourself?
evidence: You can buy dry falooda or make it yourself from scratch

conversation.text: I brought a pack of dried falooda sev from the market because it seemed like too much effort to have to make from scratch!
I do not blame you! That seems a lot easier. To cook the falooda sev, just follow the instructions on the packet
evidence: Follow the instructions on the packaging

conversation.text: Ok! I have done that. What do I need to do next?
Next, layer the falooda ingredients in two tall glasses, using half per glass.
evidence: Layer the falooda ingredients in a glass.

conversation.text: In what order shall I do this?
Begin with the basil seeds, then the cooked falooda sev, then the rose syrup, and finally the milk.
evidence: Basil seeds Cooked falooda sev Rose syrup Milk

conversation.text: Okay. The basil seeds have seemed to have floated to the top. What shall I do about that?
Not to worry! That is perfectly ok.
evidence: it's OK if basil seeds or falooda sev float to the top at this point.

conversation.text: Great. I think I am ready for the next step.
Next, add a scoop of ice-cream to each glass.
evidence: Top each glass with a generous scoop of vanilla ice-cream.

conversation.text: What flavour ice-cream shall I use
Vanilla. What color is the drink?
Thank you. It is a pale pink color
That sounds great! Finally, you can garnish, if you wish, using chopped pistachios and rose petals.
evidence: you can add a handful of chopped pistachios and rose petals to the top of the drink as a garnish

conversation.text: Thank you. Can I keep this for later if I do not want to enjoy immediately?
Unfortunately not. You should serve it immediately as it will not keep if it sits, or is stored.
evidence: Serve the falooda immediately. It does not keep if allowed to sit or stored in the refrigerator.

conversation.text: Understandable. Thank you very much for your assistance. It tastes absolutely delicious!
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this cooking task.
Thanks for your help.

procedure.summary: Get hard-to-find ingredients at an Indian grocery store.
procedure.description: Milk, sugar, and ice cream should be available at almost any supermarket, but basil seeds, rose syrup, and falooda sev will not usually be. For these, you'll need to visit an Indian or South Asian grocer. You may be able to find them at certain non-Indian specialty grocers' as well. Most of these ingredients are also available for order online if you do not have a place to buy them near you. Falooda sev is a type of Indian noodle somewhat similar to vermicelli. You can buy dry falooda or make it yourself from scratch. A good falooda sev recipe is available here.

In a cup, cover the basil seeds with an inch of water. Stir once, then let them soak for 30 minutes. After soaking, drain them in a fine mesh strainer and set aside. While you wait for the seeds to soak, feel free to proceed to the next few steps.

Pour the two ingredients into a medium saucepan and bring to a gentle boil, stirring occasionally. Lower the heat and let simmer for 5-7 minutes. Pour the thickened milk into separate container and let it chill in the fridge.

Follow the instructions on the packaging for best results. If you made your own falooda sev or your packaging doesn't have instructions, follow these steps:
Bring water to a boil in a small pot. Add falooda sev and cook for about 4-5 minutes. Drain the falooda in a strainer, rinsing it with cold water to stop the cooking process. Use a knife or pair of scissors to cut the noodles into small pieces.

procedure.summary: Layer the falooda ingredients in a glass.
procedure.description:
Grab two tall, decorative glasses to serve your beverages in. Add ingredients to each glass in the following order (use half of each ingredient per glass):
Basil seeds
Cooked falooda sev
Rose syrup
Milk — it's OK if basil seeds or falooda sev float to the top at this point.

procedure.summary: Top each glass with a generous scoop of vanilla ice-cream.
procedure.description: If you want, you can mash the ice cream into the drink to dissolve it, but you don't need to. If you leave the ice cream alone, dunk it into the milk at least once to give it some of the rose flavor.

The falooda is ready to drink at this point. If you wish, you can add a handful of chopped pistachios and rose petals to the top of the drink as a garnish, though this is not needed. Serve the falooda immediately. It does not keep if allowed to sit or stored in the refrigerator. Enjoy!
